snippet: A Tibetan activist whose long, harsh detention by Chinese authorities drew international scrutiny has been freed, exile groups reported on Tuesday.
abstract: Jigme Gyatso, Tibetan activist whose long, harsh detention by Chinese authorities drew international scrutiny, has been freed after serving 17 years in prison; Jigme Gyatso is said to be extremely frail after years of torture and poor medical care.
lead_paragraph: A Tibetan activist whose long, harsh detention by Chinese authorities drew international scrutiny has been freed, exile groups reported on Tuesday.

headline.seo: China Frees Jigme Gyatso, a Tibetan Activist
headline.main: China Frees Frail Tibetan in Prison for Activism
headline.print_headline: China Frees Frail Tibetan In Prison For Activism

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
